alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Calhoun; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:20PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwestern West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Calhoun, Jackson and Roane. In southern West Virginia, Kanawha, Lincoln and Putnam. In western West Virginia, Cabell. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 PM EST, Emergency management reported numerous roads closed in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, Hamlin, Jefferson, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Milton, Eleanor, Buffalo, Poca, Kenna, Cross Lanes, Institute, Teays Valley, Tornado, Alum Creek and Amma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Cabell; Calhoun; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam; Roane
